DECENTRALISATION.Definition: the transfer of control of an activity or organisation to several local offices or authorities

DEMOCRATISATION.Definition: the introduction of a system that involves everyone

UNACCENTED.Definition: not characterised by any particular accent

CHARM.Definition: the power of being very pleasant and attractive

BINOCULARS.Definition: an instrument with a special glass for each eye, used for viewing distant objects.

SECURITY BADGES.Definition: small pieces of metal used as marks and worn to identify a member of a security group

TAKING THE INTELLIGENCE WORLD BY STORM.Definition: quickly becoming very popular among people who are involved with collecting secret information

TRIED HIS HAND.Definition: tried to do it for the first time

KEEP UP.Definition: move at the same rate, be as fast

CAPTION.Definition: a short piece of text under a picture

CONFUSE.Definition: make them less able to understand what was going on

REBEL.Definition: someone who had taken arms against or had resisted authority

FROM THE COMFORT OF.Definition: while enjoying the comfort or ease of

FOREIGN AGENT.Definition: a spy for a foreign country

SHOT DOWN.Definition: brought down after being shot at

THE FINGER WAS QUICKLY POINTED.Definition: the blame was quickly put on, they quickly thought to be the ones responsible for the action

REBELS.Definition: people who had taken arms against or had resisted authority

BINGO.Definition: used to express satisfaction after a successful try

DRONES.Definition: aircrafts that do not have a pilot but are controlled by someone on the ground

BLAMED.Definition: thought they were responsible for the action

STILL TO COME.Definition: to happen or be achieved at a later time

NERVE-AGENT.Definition: a poison that affects the nerves

DOUBLE-AGENT.Definition: a person pretending to work as a spy for one government while actually working as a spy for another government

THE FINGER WAS IMMEDIATELY POINTED AT.Definition: the blame was immediately put on, they immediately thought to be the ones responsible for the action

STATE-SPONSORED.Definition: paid or supported by the government

IN A BID TO.Definition: in an attempt to, trying to

BETRAYING.Definition: showing disloyalty, being unfaithful by giving information to foreigners

ALL DIPLOMATIC AVENUES HAD BEEN EXHAUSTE.Definition: nothing more could be done in a diplomatic way or by conversation

VOLUNTEERS.Definition: people who helped them willingly and without being paid

YEARBOOKS.Definition: a book containing photographs of a class in a school and details of activities in the previous year

BLACK-MARKET.Definition: a system in which something is sold and bought illegally

MATCH.Definition: a person who resembled or looked the same as him

AMATEURS.Definition: people who were involved without being paid, non professionals

COMIC TURN.Definition: funny development or change in the situation

CAUGHT RED HANDED.Definition: caught while they were in the act of doing something wrong

ASSASSINS.Definition: people who murder someone for political reasons

TURNING POINT.Definition: the time at which things started to change

HOBBYISTS.Definition: people who were doing it as a hobby or in their free time for pleasure

HARMLESS.Definition: not able or likely to cause harm or damage

STEP-BY-STEP.Definition: by degrees, one step at a time

TIMESTAMPED.Definition: having the time they were taken recorded or shown

DATASETS.Definition: collections of related sets of information

ALGORITHMS.Definition: sets of mathematical instructions that make it possible for computers to find answers to problems

CONTRIBUTORS.Definition: people who help by providing information

ACCUSED.Definition: said to have done something wrong

EXPOSING DIRT.Definition: revealing secrets they didn't want people to know about or making them known

TARGET.Definition: one selected as the aim or subject

CONVENIENT.Definition: suitable or right for their purposes

DECENTRALISED.Definition: not belonging to a centre of control

HOW YOU GET ON.Definition: how you are advancing or progressing
